column1: Gilbert disease is a common disorder passed down through families.
Gilbert disease affects 1 in 10 people in some white groups.

Symptoms may include: - Fatigue - Yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes (mild jaundice) In people with Gilbert disease, jaundice most often appears during times of exertion, stress, and infection, or when they do not eat.
A blood test for bilirubin shows changes that occur with Gilbert disease.
No treatment is necessary for Gilbert disease.
Call your health care provider if you have jaundice or pain in the abdomen that does not go away.
